function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Uncertainty in the information gleaned from monitoring for SARS-CoV-2 RNA in wastewater","Impact":"Lack of accurate data may hinder public health responses and economic relief efforts, leading to prolonged economic and social burden","Mitigation":"Invest in research and development to improve the sensitivity and reliability of wastewater-based epidemiology assays","Technologies":"Advanced testing and analysis technologies for wastewater samples","People":"General population, public health officials, policymakers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies, government organizations"},{"Description":"Potential bias in wastewater temperature as a source of data bias in wastewater-based epidemiology","Impact":"Inaccurate data may lead to misinterpretation of public health risks and ineffective interventions","Mitigation":"Implement calibration methods to account for temperature variations, conduct further research on temperature influence on viral persistence","Technologies":"Temperature monitoring and calibration tools, advanced data analysis techniques","People":"Public health researchers, epidemiologists, data analysts","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies"},{"Description":"Estimation of initial SARS-CoV-2 loads and persistence in wastewater","Impact":"Inaccurate estimation may lead to underestimation or overestimation of the actual viral presence in wastewater, affecting public health responses","Mitigation":"Refine estimation methods, validate assumptions through empirical data, and collaborate with experts in virology and wastewater management","Technologies":"Advanced analytical tools, virology expertise, empirical data collection and analysis","People":"Researchers, virologists, wastewater management experts","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies"}]}
